definition: to empty one's pocket/to give everything to help sb
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
sack/purse/pocket (for money)

sentences.english: Then he would get out his money and take the fish and crabs and turtles to the shore and let them go.
sentences.chinese: 然后就倾囊而出，把鱼蟹乌龟买下来去岸边放生。

sentences.english: Shifu taught you well but he didn't teach you everything.
sentences.chinese: 师傅把你们教的不错，但没有倾囊相授。

sentences.english: Shi Fu taught you well, but he didn't teach you everything.
sentences.chinese: 师傅确实把你教得很好，但是他没有倾囊相授。

sentences.english: Budget pressures have made them highly reluctant to spend money on helping the incomers.
sentences.chinese: 预算压力使他们很难倾囊扶助外来人口。

sentences.english: He taught his students all he knew.
I am a professional matchmaker, and here's what I know
sentences.chinese: 我是一个职业媒人，在此把我所知倾囊相送。

sentences.english: Many will break the bank buying jewelry and flowers for their beloveds.
sentences.chinese: 许多人为了心爱的人，会倾囊购买珠宝盒鲜花。

definition: to give for free
lit. to loosen one's purse/fig. to give generously to help others
to impart/to pass on/to teach
to use up entirely
all one's life/lifetime
to do all one can/to give all one has
to stint/to be miserly
not to stint/to be generous (with praise etc)/to be prepared to (pay a fee, give of one's time etc)
to contribute generously (idiom); help sb generously with money/to give generously to charity
variant of 吝[lin4]
stingy
lit. to put everything out including the tray/to reveal everything/to make a clean breast of it all
to join a guru for instruction
lit. do not begrudge gems of wisdom (idiom, humble expr.); fig. Please give me your frank opinion./Your criticism will be most valuable.
to make painstaking efforts (idiom); after much trouble/to work hard at sth
to admire wholeheartedly/to fall in love with
to give a present/to accord (a favor)/to grant
